items.title: Management Consultant. Software Project Delivery | Munich, Germany
items.content:
*HOW WILL A TYPICAL DAY BE SPENT?*

* Engaging with developers, change professionals, business analysts and project managers.
* Executing proof of concepts before architecting and deploying appropriate technical solutions.
* Using your business acumen to ensure technical implementations are fit for purpose.
* Designing, implementing and testing component reusability models.
* Supporting clients, giving demos, training, mentoring, providing consultancy services.
* Showcasing solutions, outlining benefits, identifying potential future business opportunities.

*WHAT'S THE WORKING CULTURE LIKE?*

Passionate, driven, ambitious, collaborative. Personal career journeys are firmly aligned to the corporate roadmap. Big company ambitions with a small company feel. Consultants are fiercely loyal to the company and this is borne out by a very low attrition rate.

*WHAT'S INTERESTING ABOUT THE ROLE?*

In many ways you will feel like your own boss. You will need to be independent, flexible and able to travel extensively throughout Europe and across the globe. The role will bring lots of autonomy including a significant opportunity for remote working.

*WHAT ARE THE CHALLENGES?*

If you enjoy the formal structure of a corporate environment then this is not for you. You will need be self-motivated and versatile enough to wear multiple hats i.e. consultant, project manager, business analyst, technician, mentor, adviser. You will have a network of consultants to support you in the early days but thereafter you will be expected to stand on your own two feet.

*WHAT'S MY BACKGROUND?*

You come from a technical hands-on development (.NET, Java, C# or similar) environment and be looking to move (or have recently moved) into a more strategic, consultative, client-facing role such as business analysis or project management.

*PROGRESSION?*

This is a fantastic opportunity to be part of an exciting success story and to grow with a company that has world-class ambitions. In many ways progression will be what you make it.

*WHAT ARE THE NUMBERS?*

Up to EUR 85,000 + excellent benefits + share options.

items.title: Creative Manager/ Director (paid in Equity)
items.content:
Creative Manager

About us

We are an award winning dating app, www.clikapp.com who cater for creatives. We won an award at the UK DatinG Awards for Innovation, were listed as one of the best dating apps for men 2017 in the telegraph and have enjoyed some great traction. We are now looking for a creative director / manager to help us keep on brand cool, creative and fun. We are a startup, so we want someone who is keen to join us on this journey.

I should say that we are fundraising at the moment, and as such have limited funds, which is why we are keen to bring someone in who is keen to enter the world of startups and wants to grow with the company, payment will be in the form of equity within the company and we will cover expenses and travel to and from the office so you are not out of pocket. However this is for someone who is looking to the future or wants to gain some experience in startups. Please check out our website – www.clikdapp.com we have an incredibly strong team and are looking for someone who can join very quickly and muck in and get involved.


Ideal experience


You’ll be entrepreneurial by nature and have experience of being a creative leader, this could be in film/ photography/ graphic design or marketing.
Experience of working as a photographer and have links into the photographic community would be ideal.
You will understand how to interact with photographers and to judge good quality photography.
Be creative and clever and have a quick wit, we want someone who can bring some spark to our creative department.
Will be able to manage others well, and be willing to manage interns, assess work and give feedback.
The spirit and approach of an entrepreneur with very strong commercial acumen in order to deliver real value in a small business environment
Strong communication skills and the ability to build strong working relationships internally and with our marketing partners
Ideally but not essential direct experience of the UK dating or social networking environment.


The Role
Will be working alongside the founder and we want someone who will work 3-5 days a week, we will consider both fulltime and part time roles depending on the candidate and their skill set we may have flexibility for someone who has another role or is consulting.


Message from the founder.
We have a strong team and a great product, and we are looking for someone who wants to come on this exciting journey with us. We believe this company has what it takes to become a superstar so we want to surround ourselves with people who are willing to sacrifice to be part of it. We value hard work, entrepreneurial spirit and out the box thinking mentality. There will be a whole range of jobs for you to get involved in, some fun, some not so much but you want to work in startups so this is the game.. But if this sounds like you, drop us an email and lets grab a coffee and have a chat.

items.title: Business Development Manager
items.content:
TheMove.com is a pre launch prop tech startup that provides lead generation services for brokers and developers in the real estate industry. Our lead generation model is ready to disrupt a $500bn market for the better and after successful trials in three continents we are ready to build a team to launch in New York.


The Position

We are looking for a seasoned consultative salesperson with next-level interpersonal awareness and the ability to work with the founding team in developing our business in New York City.

As the Business Development Manager in our NYC office, you will be responsible for implementing the onboarding process for new brokers and property developers and undertaking an account management role for current clients. Whether you’re meeting with Sales Associates or Directors, you must be comfortable pitching our idea and acting as an evangelist for TheMove!

A previous background in real-estate or the property industry is highly desirable, however not essential.
The role will likely involve travel across the country and occasional remote working.


Role responsibilities

Business Development: Developing and building out our commercial proposition to both customers and real estate agents, owning the adoption and onboarding process.

Customer Experience: Developing our customer proposition and owning the customer experience, from customer service to the sales funnel

Operational Execution: Playing a lead role in the operational execution within your area, from corporate development (presentations, finances, legals) to our city-by-city rollout activation strategy to highly challenging operational tasks such as overseeing the management of our cutting 24/7 Virtual Assistant function.

KPI Focused: To work alongside the Country Manager to design key performance indicators that can be implemented across the NYC market.

Passion for working in an exciting tech-startup and willingness to go the extra mile.

Startups are challenging, hardworking and unstructured environments – they are not for everyone!


In return you will receive:

A chance to make a direct impact to the success of the business from day one, we have global ambitions and success will be rewarded by rapid progression

A competitive salary DOE

A great coworking office in Williamsburg

Please email a CV and cover letter to recruitment@themove.com
Please include within the letter your earliest start date.

items.title: Head Coach / Chief Education Officer
items.content:
Head Coach / Chief Education Officer at Enki

San Francisco, Remote · Full Time
Compensation
$50K–$100K
0.25%–1.0%
Visa Sponsorship
Available

Job Description

We are looking for an experienced developer to join the founding team of Enki as our head of teaching. This involves being responsible for what and how we teach our users to become the best developers they can be.

Summary:

We are a fast-growing early-stage company backed by top investors and with a founder who has built two $100m+ valuation companies before.

Our mission is to organize the world's professional knowledge, and in doing so reinvent how learning and employee development is done in the workplace.

Since our launch in Q1 2016, over over 200,000 software developers have downloaded our applications. We have a clear path to building the biggest community of developers, collaborating around learning and staying ahead of the tech curve.

Requirements:

- Experience in successfully coaching software developers in some capacity;
- Strong communication and technical writing skills;
- Broad knowledge of key modern technologies and major programming languages;
- Entrepreneurial mindset, taking initiative and actively contributing to the product and vision;
- Ideally, experience in a startup environment of building and growing consumer products.

Responsibilities:

- Complete ownership of the content and curriculum on Enki, and how it fits within the product;
- Hiring and working with expert contributors to ensure high quality content;
- Active iteration of current teaching methods and content formats;
- Measurement and assessment of Enki's impact on the skills and carriers of our users.

Key benefits:

- Huge impact potential: changing the way millions of people learn every day.
- Exceptional autonomy and decision power: you will be treated like a co-founder.
- Unique culture of experimentation and learning to fast-track your career.
- Equity included, since you'll be part of the founding team.
- Compensation and perks in line with high-end technology companies.

Thanks for your interest! Get in touch with the CEO (kirill@enki.com) if you'd like to find out more.

items.title: Program Consultant, Program Placement Team
items.content:
Program Consultant, Program Placement Team - Jobmote

Program Consultant, Program Placement Team

Remote Year

Remote Year

Remote Year curates communities of interesting professionals, entrepreneurs, and freelancers from across the globe to spend either 4 or 12 months together working, traveling, and exploring cities around the world. Programs spend one month in each location, connecting with local cultures and business ecosystems, while forming lifelong, personal and professional relationships along the way. Together we will shape the future of work.

Role Description

Remote Year’s Program Placement team is searching for experienced consumer sales representatives, who we call Program Consultants, to match potential participants with the right Remote Year itinerary and community. Our Program Consultants act as the face of Remote Year to our customers, they are responsible for filling each community we launch. You will readily bring your drive, empathy, and consultative sales skills to this role. Ideally, you love being coached to succeed and working with your teammates to surpass all of your goals.

Responsibilities:

  • By deploying our sales process, best practices, systems, and deep product knowledge you lead our customers through an inclusive consultative sales process.
  • Build strong relationships through clear honest communication with both our customers and the Program Placement Team.
  • Actively collect data on your performance to grow. Using Salesforce, you track every lead in your pipeline and know immediately which leads to prioritize.
  • As a salesperson, you are accountable to daily, weekly, monthly, and quarterly goals.
  • Undergo extensive sales development and coaching to perfect your performance at any point in the conversion process.
  • Use all of the sales tools given to you and provide consistent feedback to your managers on process functionality.

What You Bring:

  • Minimum 1-3 years experience in consumer sales.
  • Experience with Salesforce or another CRM.
  • Ability to perform at a high level, in a fast pace startup work environment.
  • Amazing communication skills and willingness to accept constructive feedback.
  • A coachable and adaptable mindset.

Preferred Qualification:

  • Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution.
  • Experience selling with a fully distributed team.
  • Experience in an inbound sales environment.

items.title: Product Development Manager
items.content:
We are seeking a veteran, process-oriented Product Manager to become a key member of our product leadership team. Working with existing product team, you will help act as the interface between a globally dispersed team of developers, QA professionals and members of a remote, sales-driven organization.

You will be responsible for balancing needs between infrastructure and product development requirements. You will work with stakeholders and product team members to collect, understand, and translate the business needs of our internal and external clients into technical language for your development team. You will share ownership over the product roadmap and be responsible for forecasting and maintaining on-time delivery of roadmap items.

You will work with a team that is charged with helping to increase the profitability of existing products and to develop new products for the company. You will build products from existing ideas, and help to develop new ideas based on your industry experience and your contact with customers, prospects, and internal clients. You must possess a unique blend of business and technical savvy; have big-picture vision, and the drive to make that vision a reality. You must enjoy spending time in the market to understand its problems and find innovative solutions.

You must be able to communicate efficiently and effectively up, down, and laterally within and without our organization. You will work with an engineering counterpart to define product release requirements and with the company marketing team to define the go-to-market strategy, and help them understand the product positioning, key benefits, and target customers. You will also serve as the internal and external evangelist for your product offering, often working with the sales team and key customers/partners.
Responsibilities:

Gain a deep understanding of customer experience to identify and fill product gaps
Generate new ideas that grow market share, improve customer experience, and drive growth
Work with all stakeholders to prioritize and define features and tasks, aligned with strategic initiatives and business drivers
Evaluate competitor and technology landscape and identify niche opportunities that leverage our product line’s strengths and other weaknesses
Assess market competition by comparing the company's product to competitors' products.
Provide information for management by preparing short-term and long-term product success forecasts, special reports and analyses, and answer questions and requests.
Drive a solution set across development teams (primarily Development/Engineering and Marketing) through market requirements, product contracts, and positioning.
Propel product launches forward by working with the public relations team, executives, and other members of the management team
Translate product strategy into detailed requirements
Identify and provide solutions for unique client requirements without completely diverging from the roadmap and product vision
Brainstorm with the management team and contribute to the creation and maintenance of a product-line strategy and roadmap
Work closely with engineering teams to deliver quick time-to-market solutions

Skills and Experience
6+ years of Product Management/Project Management experience
Experience in a technology driven product environment, preferably SaaS product, B2B or B2C
Experience building SaSS based business models within the product; onboarding, billing, plan management, etc.
Technology background in SQL and Ruby on Rails
Experience working with API’s and integrating with third party API’s
Able to quickly learn new technological environments and keep updated on industry trends
Experience working with remote teams – a plus
Proven track record of managing all aspects of a successful product throughout its lifecycle
Proven ability to align/develop product and marketing strategies and effectively communicate recommendations to executive management
Strong problem solving skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Product management experience in a SaaS, cloud, or marketing software environment
Clear and precise communications skills, and ability to work with remotely distributed teams
Solid technical background with understanding and/or hands-on experience in software development and web technologies
BS/BA required in Computer Science or a related technical field, MBA a plus
Strong background in analyzing multiple data sets, demonstrating the ability to understand key performance drivers and ability to execute against findings
Strong technical architectural understanding of mobile and web products
Must have experience working with design and engineering teams to deliver end to end products
Strong understanding of UX best practices and ability to craft well thought out wireframes to communicate ideas effectively to development team as well as stakeholders.
A team-player attitude with willingness to get all hands on deck and roll up sleeves to achieve the best result

Job Description

This is a business development role working with the digital media agency & publishers industry. Meaning you need to talk great and write great, and most importantly, make agencies, media and publishers subscribe for Lobster.

Lobster is looking for a person experienced in working with (or better off within!) digital media, advertising agencies and creatives of all sorts. This is a very important role for us great dedication and a share option in the company, it is almost a co-founder role.

We have developed an outstanding tool for the agencies and publishers to find exactly right social media visual content and license it for work from the authors. Now we are turning it into the whole world’s honest place to access real people’s content and it’s your turn to come on stage and reach all the agencies that need it.

We can only consider people in London and settled in the UK to join the team at this time, even though you may be in office only occasionally.

Job Description

Novanet is seeking full-time business development professionals for its domestic and international sales organisation in five cities i.e. Mumbai, Bangalore, Hyderabad, Delhi and Chennai.

Sales at Novanet is about consistently meeting customer requirements. We firmly believe in enriching customer experience by ensuring the quick deployment and easy-adoption of our products. The team is responsible for establishing and nurturing customer relationships.

PREFERRED WORK EXPERIENCE

0-2 Years

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

- You will be responsible for finding out key contacts from your region, networking and initiating dialogues with seasoned IT professionals.

- As a sales professional, you will be expected to conduct meetings with such decision makers and generate interest by providing value propositions for our amazing product lineup.

-Your role as an account executive will extend to customer success management as well. You will be involved in various cross-sell/up-sell opportunities and ensure timely collection of revenue.

-You will get to work closely with the Marketing Team to define lead generation campaigns, customer profiling and market surveys.

WHY NOVANET SALES?

- Novanet has an amazing incentive structure that makes sure that you collect your incentives as long the customer generates revenue for Novanet.

- We place no restriction targeting potential customers across the globe.

- We offer an above-average industry standard compensation and domestic/international travel opportunities.

WHAT DO YOU NEED?

- Although, a passion for sales overcomes every educational qualification, but for academic purposes we will be accepting graduates with 0-2 yrs experience.

- Candidates with technical background or interest in latest technologies shall also be preferred

- Excellent communication and inter-personal Skills.

- Having personal conveyance is encouraged for intra-city travelling.

We are a top ten UK media publisher, with a website loved by millions: a technology company at heart with industry-leading success metrics propelled by a highly experienced multi-disciplinary engineering team that can afford to run lean. Which means today, we offer all the excitement and agility of a start-up, but with the stability and benefits of an established business — we’re still a company where everyone gets to make a massive impact!

Our mission: to democratise and disrupt the market for news. Today, we have major plans for growth, both here in the UK and abroad, and to create even more social capital out of what has been an extremely successful platform: through increased editorial direction, curating credible but independent journalism, as well as through computational approaches to identifying the best news to show our users.

We currently have these opportunities:

- As a /Head of Digital Product/, you’ll take over from our CEO in keeping all our development efforts incredibly well organised and delivering the vision. You’ll grasp our strategic vision, consult with stakeholders to prioritise and specify desired developments, and co-ordinate the work of our agile development team to balance our editorial, development and commercial goals and deliver them with maximum efficiency.

- As a /Designer/Developer/, you’ll be responsible for designing all aspects of the website UI and brand, and work closely with Head of Digital Product and senior management on the biggest redesign of our homepage in 20 years. You will be working with Adobe Creative Suite, JavaScript, CSS3, SASS, HTML5, Responsive Web Design, progressive enhancement and feature detection.

- As a /Fully Remote Web Developer/, you’ll write the logic that drives the UI, and integrate new UI with back-end data. You’ll also work on a wide array of other UI/UX, SEO, and content integration challenges.

- As a /Fully Remote Full Stack Developer/, you’ll be expected to contribute authoritatively towards product development projects throughout the entire software stack: from database and infrastructure installation and configuration, through writing business logic and prototyping website presentation, to developing our bespoke programmatic advertising technologies.

- As a /Fully Remote News Algorithm Developer/, you’ll develop automated curation algorithms that will produce the content for a new homepage format.

- As a /Fully Remote Back End Software Engineer/, your projects will largely be server-side. You will bring a sophisticated approach to problem solving, finding ways to achieve objectives while addressing scalability challenges and security concerns.

All London positions are based at our centrally-located head office.All fully remote roles are open to UK residents only.

If you think you’re a fit for any of these roles, please apply online. http://www.NewsNow.co.uk/careers/

items.title: Agile Delivery Manager
items.content:
Job Title: Delivery Manager
Reports to: CTO
Hours: Full time
Location: Piccadilly Circus
Contract type: Full Time

Job description:

DM-Companies have an exciting opportunity to join as a Delivery Manager working within one of our emerging delivery teams.
As this is the start of our journey towards autonomous delivery teams you will play a big part in leading the agile delivery process and working with the team to provide them support in their agile journey.
You will be confident building and maintaining motivation within the team and making sure that there is an iterative plan to work towards.
A big part of your role will be to demonstrate how teams should collaborate, communicate and focus by actually getting your hands dirty with the team.
Initially taking ownership within the team to ensure that we are focused on delivering value to business you will lead the way in how the team should work and act. Overtime this ownership will be shared amongst the team creating a high performing autonomous team
You will be experienced at facing evolving challenges head-on, hardworking, creative and solutions focused, whilst being comfortable working in a start-up culture.

Key Responsibilities:
● Establish and own communication channels
● Coordination and creation of iterative delivery plan
● Maintaining a motivated team
● Proactively manage risks, dependencies, obstacles and constraints
● Protect the team and ensure the team are focused
● Take ownership of delivery within the team
● Ensure team ceremonies are in place and executed well
● Own and champion agile within the team

Personality Profile:
● A confident leader of people who is able to inspire and drive the team
● A friendly, positive and enthusiastic person who can work as part of a diverse team.
● Strong communication skills both verbal and written
● Remaining positive and approachable at all times.
● Willing to take on a new intellectual challenge with a positive attitude.
● Able to prioritize and meet deadlines.
● Team player.
● Thrives in a dynamic and rapidly changing environment.


Required Skills:
● Very organised
● Great communication skills
● Management of development teams
● Comfortable communicating with technical and non-technical colleagues
● Experience and understanding of agile principles
● Project Management experience of multiple projects simultaneously
● Experience and understanding of agile principles
● Knowledge of development process
● Ability to influence key stakeholders

Desired Skills & Experience:
● Technical background
● High traffic application experience
● Coaching experience
● Working with local and remote teams
● JIRA Administration

About us:

DM-Companies is a privately owned entrepreneurial company; practicality and innovation are at the forefront of what we do.
Our Aim is to provide easy to use online platforms to offer useful local services. Our office in the UK is located in the heart of Soho in central London and has an exciting vibrant atmosphere. Joining us means joining a multicultural team of 18 nationalities.
Vivastreet is a free classifieds website with more than 35 million users monthly across 13 countries, our aim is to offer our users a simple and sociable shopping and selling experience through its extensive choice of adverts ranging from buy and sell services, properties, cars, events, pets, friendships, love and much more, all in their local area.
Easyroommate is the world's leading flatshare website, we have sites in 25 countries globally and 2.5 million users monthly, with our added first-class customer service team and a growing community of users, Easyroommate is the easiest way for people to rent a spare room and showcase it to an audience of millions.

We look after everyone who works for us, in exchange for your dedication we offer:
• Regular training and development programs
• Social events
• Company lunch every other Friday

We are a vibrant business full of creative and passionate people who enjoy sharing ideas and working on exciting new projects.

All candidates must be eligible to work in the UK on a permanent basis.

Please note due to the volume of applications received for this position we are only able to contact successful candidates

Additional Information:
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

items.title: Head of Engineering
items.content:
At Tallysticks, we believe that international trade brings the global community together. We’re opening up growth for independent businesses, building trust with their trading partners and confidence in their trade potential. We’ve simplified the end-to-end trade process by creating a single online tool for documentation, communications and payments. Tallysticks reduces the effort, cost and risk of trade management for independent businesses. Our aim is to help SMEs around the world grow their business.

What is Tallysticks?
Tallysticks is a solution that helps customers create, negotiate, and agree international (containerised) trade contracts with ease. The solution is comprised of two key products:

1) a trade book - an application enabling importers and exporters to draft and sign legally binding trade contracts
2) a payments mechanism - a framework that allows buyers and sellers to confidently exchange payment in a protected manner

We have a number of different products and applications envisaged over the coming years, but the above two are the focus for 2018.

Head of Engineering
As the Head of Engineering, you will be working closely with the CTO to devise how we will execute the tech vision.

The role:
You will be working with the Head of Product to manage the sprints, ensure that the backlog is being met and is understood but everyone in the engineering team. You will also work closely with the COO to manage our hiring pipeline.

You will also be expected to think critically and intelligently about how engineering and its challenges fits into the company’s wider strategic vision and to take part in tech planning and architectural discussions.

Successful candidate profile
The successful candidate will want to build a successful engineering culture with the company and should have a proven track record of delivering successful software products and growing high-performance teams.

- Able to intelligently assess the trade-offs with different technology choices such as databases, cloud services, languages and approaches to development
- Experience of managing development teams in an agile environment
- Strong prioritisation and estimation skills
- Strongly familiar with cloud computing concepts (we use AWS)
- Understanding of security and basic cryptography concepts
- Must understand continuous delivery and its importance
- Has experience of web paradigms such as Microservices, REST, WebSockets, Authentication
- Able to create a winning hiring-strategy for our developers

When does the position start?
We only accept the best candidates and as such are in no rush. We hope to have the right person through the door by February 2018 but we will wait for the right person.

Application process
1) Send CV and Cover Letter
2) Phone Screening Interview with competency based questions
3) Take-home test
4) Face-to-Face interview

Remuneration and package
We offer a competitive package including salary and equity. We are a meritocracy and reward good work.

Tallysticks leadership team
- CEO: ex JP-Morgan Emerging Markets Analyst, ex US Diplomat and previous SME owner
- CTO: ex CTO of CarThrottle
- COO: ex KPMG Machine Learning Product Manager, ex Berlin Tech Accelerator
- Head of Product: ex TechStars Mentor and B2B and B2C Product Manager

items.title: Origin (http://www.originprotocol.com) is a blockchain project focused on building the sharing economy without intermediaries. We're creating ...
items.content:
Origin (http://www.originprotocol.com) is a blockchain project focused on building the sharing economy without intermediaries. We're creating protocols to allow buyers and sellers of fractional usage assets and services (think Airbnb, Getaround, Fiverr, Taskrabbit) to transact without paying middlemen 20-30%.

We're experienced founders who have built and sold multiple businesses in the past. Origin is the most ambitious idea we've tackled to date (hopefully on the right side of crazy).We currently have a working MVP built on Ethereum and IPFS. We're looking for all sorts of people to join our team, whether you code in react, python or solidity. We're a distributed team and open to remote.

Ping us at founders@originprotocol.com if you're interested.

items.title: Lean Startup Co: Product Manager with Project Management Experience (Lean Startup practitioner required)
items.content:
Product Manager with Project Management Experience (Lean Startup practitioner required)

Posted Nov 24

Lean Startup Co
Headquarters: San Francisco, CA
https://lean-startup-co.breezy.hr/p/a5458172dce001-product-manager-with-project-management-experience-lean-startup-practitioner-required?source=weworkremotely

Lean Startup Company offers the most exciting education solutions available today in modern management. We are a startup with global brand recognition headquartered in San Francisco, CA. We bring the entrepreneurial spirit to large organizations through cutting-edge education and modern management techniques. Lean Startup methodology provides a scientific approach and framework for innovation, so you can learn what your customers really want. It’s about testing your vision continuously, so you can effectively adapt and adjust before it’s too late.


ABOUT THE POSITION

We're seeking a part-time Product Manager with Project Management experience for The Lean Startup Co. Education Program to lead the execution of an important initiative that will set the stage for an extraordinary transformation at a large, national organization.

In this role, your project management expertise and uncanny ability to obtain buy-in at all levels will serve you well. You’ll lead a group of subject matter experts, client stakeholders and creatives to help build and scale a program that will empower its participants to innovate and adapt to market changes using Lean Startup methodology.

You will make a massive impact in this initiative by leading the team towards the same objective, while managing and prioritizing resources to ensure client needs are met.

You’ll Work on Projects Like

  • Scaling the adoption of Lean Startup methodology across a large organization
  • Working with subject matter experts and content creators to develop unique program training materials. Think playbooks and field guides, coach-the-coach curriculum and marketing collateral

You’ll excel in (and enjoy!) this role if

  • You have a track record of:
  • Working with Lean Startup methodology at an intermediate (required) or higher level
  • Scaling a methodology (i.e. Lean Startup, Agile, Design Thinking) across a large organization
  • Creating a program that embeds a mindset and mechanics of a cultural shift across the organization
  • Coordinating, planning, executing, and tracking large scale implementation or organization change projects from beginning to end
  • Proactively working with stakeholders to drive initiatives forward, and ensure on time delivery of deliverables
  • Facilitating meetings and ensuring alignment across stakeholder groups
  • Demonstrating a proactive focus on meeting client and project requirements in a timely and cost effective manner
  • Operating under conditions of uncertainty and with minimal guidance
  • Maintaining accurate documentation, including timelines, budget updates, meeting notes, and timeframes
  • Managing competing priorities and ensuring stakeholders are clear on the path forward
  • Overseeing stakeholder and team metrics dashboard data
  • You are an incredible communicator in virtual video meetings and in writing. People respond quickly to your email requests with the information you need.
  • You pride yourself on being proactive, responsive and exceptional at managing expectations.
  • You enjoy working collaboratively (yay, for google docs!) and thrive in a fast-paced environment where we love challenging ourselves (in Lean Startup fashion) to build, measure, and learn.
  • You are open to feedback, take ownership of your mistakes, and love applying your lessons learned to get 10x better.
  • You are familiar with remote working tools such as Slack, Zoom, Google apps
  • And finally, you get brownie points if you:
    • Have remote work experience
    • Have experience working with a government client

    You’ll ensure the success of the initiative by

    • Translating vision into execution. You’ll ensure that the stakeholders and everyone involved is crystal clear on what the desired outcome is and you know how to get there with the resources you have available
    • Effectively utilizing subject matter experts and specialists to efficiently move projects forward.
    • Proactively managing people and expectations. You’ll be awesome at ensuring that the right people are in the loop on the various stages of the project and there won’t be any surprises.
    • Being customer focused. Learn the needs of the client and proactively test and advise the client on best path forward.
    • Being metrics oriented and business-driven. Sharing your knowledge from past experience scaling programs across organizations to provide guidance on the best path forward.
    • Clearly communicating scope changes and impact they have on budget and strategy.
    • Connecting and prioritizing individual initiatives to the overall strategy.

    Why You’ll Love Working With Us

    • We’re a 100% remote team using fun collaborative tools.
    • We encourage unplugging and prefer you don’t check email while you’re away.
    • Our clients are some of the largest companies in the world and you get a front row seat to the challenges they’re facing around innovation. Better yet, you get to help them solve their problems.
    • The work we do will go down in history as powerfully-transformative.
    • Experience the thrill and challenge of working in a fast-paced, growing startup.

    This is a contract-based, freelance role. The position is remote, but we ask that you’re 1) located in the U.S. and 2) available to communicate during Pacific Time business hours.

    *Note - We understand that you are eager to hear back from us. We receive a lot of applications and cannot respond to all of them. Please do not reach out to us regarding your application. If there is a mutual fit, we will contact you to move forward with the next steps in the process.

    Apply for this position

    https://lean-startup-co.breezy.hr/p/a5458172dce001-product-manager-with-project-management-experience-lean-startup-practitioner-required?source=weworkremotely

items.title: Director of Engineering (Python, Docker, GraphQL, Ansible, AWS) at FineTune Learning (Boston, MA) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Industry: Assessment, Education Technology, Human Resources
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

FineTune is seeking a director of engineering to lead a team of 13 developers. The director of engineering will be the expert in residence around infrastructure scaling, python, docker, database performance and microservices. S/he must have experience working with at least 3 production released software projects/products. S/he should be hands on tech and comfortable solving complex system problems while making sure software team understands clearly what they are building, while refactoring/architecting new and existing services to scale to support 5 million users.


S/he should also be comfortable interacting with customer and provide guidance on the technical feasibility and scope of engineering/rearchitecting needed to solve problems and deliver features.
If the director of engineering desires, one could also manage, mentor, performance review engineers in the team. Director of engineering will also work with 3 tech leads and QA team to find best ways to increase the performance of the development team and enhance software quality and development speed.

S/he will interface with CTO to continuously drive innovation and new product development while promoting and advancing the scalability and modularization of current platform we are working on with Collegeboard. S/he will be essential member of the leadership team to drive company vision and mission while scaling the software for larger audience.

About FineTune Learning

We are working on a variety of projects from componentizing and enhancing front end reactjs to optimize user experience and reusability of components.  We are constantly collecting data on users to help recommend better resources for their learning.  We build interesting but simple dashboards that may help teachers become more data driven.  We work on behavioral experiments via randomized control trial through our software. Our backend is mostly python/sqlalchemy and supports graphql and diverse set of databases depending on the application.  Continuous integration and continuous deployment are next in our pipeline. We are facing challenges in scalability and automation which we plan to tackle in 2018 and refactor code to increase the software performance and support 5 million users.  We work with our design team to make this experience engaging for effective learning. We practice agile and scrum and strive to continuously improve.

Benefits

Responsible time off
100% remote work/work from anywhere
401k
Health/dental
Profit sharing

items.content:
Regional Director at Advancing Women Executives

San Francisco, San Francisco Bay Area, Silicon Valley, Remote · Full Time
Compensation
$90K–$100K
No Equity
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

What does it feel like working for a company where clients every day say to you, "Thank you for doing what you do!"?
What does it feel like working for a company where you're impacting positive change in the world?
What does it feel like working for a company where you are constantly learning?
What does it feel like working for a company where you're stimulated intellectually by your peers while, at the same time, laughing and not taking yourself too seriously?
It feels great and this is what working at AWE feels like every day.

Advancing Women Executives (AWE) is a start-up with the mission to accelerate the careers of women in business to improve the global economy, by providing VP-level and above corporate executive women the opportunity to build cross-functional and cross-industry relationships in a safe, locally-based environment. AWE membership services include events, training, and executive coaching. AWE currently has memberships in San Francisco, Los Angeles, Silicon Valley, New York and Chicago. AWE is based in Los Angeles, CA, but has staff in all other membership cities.

AWE is seeking a highly qualified Regional Director to join our team to be based in the Bay Area and report to the Founder and CEO. The primary responsibility of this role is to sell AWE services to VP-level and above corporate executive women for the purposes of furthering AWE’s mission and generating business revenue.

Responsibilities:
Prospecting and closing new AWE memberships in San Francisco, Silicon Valley, and Los Angeles;
Network and build relationships with the top influencers in corporate America, private equity, venture capital and service industries;
Lead and develop a team of sales and client relations associates;
Executing a sales methodology with an average sales cycle of 6 weeks or less;
Partner with Associate Director of Member Relations to ensure AWE leaders are active and engaged in membership through a consultative sales approach;
Sales forecasting and new business pipeline management;
Strategize about sales and client relations process and services;
Conduct Training Sessions across California locations;
Host bi-annual events and monthly dinners with AWE leaders.

Qualifications
A successful candidate will possess:

True belief in AWE’s mission to significantly improve the number of women in senior management and on board seats;
The spirit to “Be Bold” and fearless in representing AWE, even during its start-up phase;
Spirit of generosity and service;
Intellectual curiosity and drive to problem solve;
Natural ability to connect with people and to be a connector for people;
6+ years transactional sales experience with success negotiating and closing business;
Exceptional ability to immediately establish one's credibility with senior executives;
Willingness to work outside strict job description parameters, thinking creatively about how to provide the highest level of customer/member service and overall business growth;
Excellent written and oral communication skills;
Strong public speaking skills and experience presenting to large groups;
Great sense of humor;
Excellent meeting facilitation skills; ability to conduct 100% phone-based meetings;
Solid understanding of business concepts and ability to quickly learn content terrain;
Ability to diagnose prospect needs and identify relevant resources;
Ability to meet personal and team weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual financial goals;
Solid understanding of business concepts & dynamics for large national and international corporations;
Superior time management, detail orientation and organization skills;
Bachelor's Degree required, MBA preferred.

AWE is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

StudySoup has grown 400% in just the last 12 months at universities nationwide, and we're looking for a hard working, analytics driven, full stack marketing expert to take this growth to new heights.

You'll need experience building attribution models across different products that feed into each other, and setting up funnels to help make data driven acquisition decisions.

WHAT YOU GET

* A top notch, highly curated team of individuals who are driven by their passion for success and shaping the future of education
* The unique opportunity to strategize and implement your own initiatives end to end
* An extremely fast growth early stage venture funded company
* Fun, learning experiences, good times and smiles
* Work from home

WHO YOU ARE

- You've probably run your own agency (or company), and currently have your hands in 5-10 new marketing initiatives.
- You live and breathe Google Analytics; or similar tools
- You want to create, and own our growth strategy while working closely with the operations, development and design team
- You have deep understanding of content, SEO/SEM and other paid user acquisition channels
- You love creating funnels and running tests until you find that perfect acquisition mix
- You can bring creative ideas to the table and execute on new untapped strategies

what you would do

- You will be the driving force behind everything we do at StudySoup; every new feature and initiative will stem from you
- You will ideate new tests, create a hypothesis, goals and execute the test from start to finish, measuring every step of the process

items.title: Project Management Engineer - European timezone at Platform.sh () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Cloud-Based Solutions, Continuous Delivery, PaaS
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

Job description:

Platform.sh is a groundbreaking hosting and development tool for web applications. We’re a European VC-Backed startup with a host of blue-chip Enterprise clients and a string of awards and grants (including €2m from the EU Horizon 2020 program). To reinforce our technical prowess, we are looking to grow our engineering team with an engineer that also enjoys project management. If you’re looking for an exciting, high-growth opportunity with an award-winning, cutting-edge company, this could be just the job for you

For its groundbreaking PaaS solution https://platform.sh is looking for a Project Manager with a taste for Go, good Linux system understanding, and a real hunger for the challenges of building robust, distributed systems.

Platform.sh is a PaaS shrouded in a lot of black magic (we can consistently clone a whole running cluster, with its state, databases, indexes in a matter of seconds). We want to get this down to the hundreds of milliseconds domain. Interested? There is more...

Our external API is pure Hypermedia REST + oAuth on top of Pyramid. It mechanizes the Git layer and needs more features.

We can consistently generate from the same manifest a Docker container, an LXC one, or VM disk images (AWS, Azure, OpenStack), we want more targets.

We probably have the highest industry container density. We need to get it higher.

We support any Python, Ruby, NodeJS or PHP application, it’s time to roll-out Java and .NET, and Elixir, of course Elixir.

We need to have more auto-healing on the high-availability clusters. We need more performance out of our multi-protocol ssh proxy. We need work on our Ceph Implementation; We need to get the Debian package generation streamlined and faster. We need… great ideas on how to make Platform.sh even better. Interested? Join us!

Mission :

Directly reporting to our VP of Engineering, your roles will include:

  • Engineering teams coordination for the flawless execution of ambitious, time constrained development projects
  • Work with CPO and CTO to ensure alignment between roadmap goals and short-term goals. Communication with all company stakeholders to give an incredibly clear project of both  advancement and roadblocks
  • Backlog grooming. Making it pretty. Actionable. Sublime
  • Sprint planning, estimation, critical path analysis
  • Knowing all the things ; where each skeleton is buried
  • Making projects delivery predictable. Measurable. Finding impediments and helping remove them
  • Managing with brio changes to backlog. Informing stakeholders when an injected task will cause some other story to be rejected from current sprint or be late
  • Project scopes and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders and ensuring technical feasibility
  • Review resource availability and allocation
  • Tooling around project plan and progress tracking
  • Reporting and escalation when necessary
  • Quality management. Managing the “Definition of Done” hand in hand with QA
  • Delivery management (release planning, QA follow-up) coordination with the Partner Delivery Manager

Must have :

The ideal candidate:

  • Is a true software engineer with enough low level chops. They know their system. Uses Linux. Codes. This is not a job for anyone who does not like coding. It is not a coding job. But extreme empathy with developers is absolutely required. So the candidate should be one
  • Is focused. Organized. Mature. Handles pressure. Handles multi-tasking. (Don’t worry we are nice and try to make a really nice stress-free working environment. But when the PM is panicky... well this is when stress-free disappears: PM should be the rock)
  • Has proven successful experience in project management
  • Has comprehensive knowledge of agile development. They know they Kanban from their Scrum. Know thy artifacts PM
  • Has had exposure to cloud services (AWS, Azure etc..)
  • Understands how an OS works, knows networking, how git works, and the constraints of a distributed system
  • Is proficient in at least one modern programming language (and proficient in troll deflection about what “modern programming languages” are and are not)

Nice to have :

  • Knowledge of some PHP stuff. Magento, Symfony, Drupal, eZ Platform, or Typo3. No expertise required
  • Mad Jira skillz
  • Public speaking experience
  • Proficiency in Rust or Ponylang grants you bonus points

About Platform.sh

We’re a venture capital funded, award-winning team of hard-core hackers who want to revolutionize the way that developers and agencies build and deploy web applications. We’re mostly distributed, but we meet up daily in cyberspace, and occasionally in Paris, France.  We value enthusiasm, team spirit, and a constant desire to expand personal knowledge and contribute to the community. We provide a multi-cultural, casual and balanced work environment. We recently helped launch Magento Enterprise Cloud Edition and the Sensio Cloud on Platform.sh technology.

Benefits

Work from home, wherever you are
Safe and friendly working environment
Stock options for everyone
Rest and recovery are essential to health and happiness; we get that

items.title: Lead Software Developer / Technical Project Manager at MapLarge () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Product Manager
Industry: Business Intelligence, Data & Analytics, Developer APIs
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

100% Remote: This role allows working remotely 100% of the time from anywhere in the US.  Workers must be authorized to work in the US (No Non US Applicants Please). 

Who We Need: We are looking for talented software developers to act as lead developers in a customer facing, technical project manager role.  Applicants should have a strong history as a lead software developer (no non-technical project managers, please) and should be a top notch C# and JavaScript programmer.  We are looking for sophisticated team members who are passionate about not only how UI is used, but also how the APIs, ontology, data structures, documentation, and examples come together to make both the UI components and technical APIs a pleasure for customers to use.

Typical Tasks: Typical Tasks include both writing code and leading planning activities.  You will often be acting as the lead technical point of contact on customer engagements, running internal and external planning meetings, helping to wireframe user interfaces, creating specs for the public facing APIs that drive them, doing deep dive code reviews with developers, and writing code for key portions of the deployed application.

Skills: While we hire all kinds of people and invent roles to fit them, these are the key traits we prefer for this role:

  1. Smart & High Energy Engineer - We work at a very fast pace on cutting edge hard problems and we need people who can keep up.   We need people who really love producing results for customers and who enjoy programming and exhibit the energy and creativity that comes from being fully engaged in the technical side of what we do.
  2. Strong Software Development background - This job is definitely NOT for non technical project managers. Recent, hands-on experience coding both server side (C#) and client side (JavaScript) are strongly suggested, and 5+ years work experience as a professional programmer is required.  
  3. Experience Wireframing UI & Designing APIs - You do not have to have strong artistic skills, but you should be comfortable not only spec-ing out UI wireframes but also designing the supporting technical web service API’s and/or client side component API’s.
  4. Technical Project Management:  You should be highly organized with a strong history in either technical project management or as the lead developer for complex software development projects.  
  5. Customer Facing: comfortable meeting with sophisticated customers and managing expectations on large high value projects.

About MapLarge

MapLarge provides Big Data Analytics and Visualization to make the world safer, more productive, and more efficient.  The MapLarge API provides real time geospatial and predictive analytics for over 15 billion location events per day and trillions of historical events. Analysts using our geospatial visualization capability can instantly query and visualize data on any desktop, mobile or tablet device.  All of our UI components are re-usable, data driven, event driven, API powered (client and server side), scriptable, re-configurable, savable, deep linkable, shareable etc.  We also have editor components, and data visualization wizards that allow non-technical users to import, automatically visualize data patterns (with sensible defaults that “just work”), conduct predictive analysis and also re-configure more advanced detailed settings with “what you see is what you get” editor tools.

Benefits

Flexible Hours (work whenever you like)
No Commute (work from home 100%)
Technically Excellent A+ Team solving very hard interesting problems
Friendly People - Postitive attitude is our #1 criteria
401k
We like all kinds of people
Unlimited Vacation
Family Friendly
Top Notch Health Care
Cutting Edge Tech

items.title: Software Development Manager - Must be based in the UK at ByBox () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior, Lead, Manager
Industry: Information Technology, Logistics & Distribution, Technical Services
Company size: 201-500 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Job Title:          Software Development Manager

Location:          Home-working, although frequent travel is required (UK and international).

Hours of work:  37.5 hours per week 

Reporting to:Head of R&D

At ByBox, our software solutions and smart locker technologies are keeping our UK distribution, warehousing and technical services divisions working 24/7, 365 days a year, minimising delivery times and inventory levels. As the market leader for field service supply chain solutions in the UK, we rely on our software team to innovate and build new solutions, as well as developing our existing systems, keeping ByBox ahead of the competition and reinforcing our position as a successful innovator within UK field support.

We are also successfully re-positioning ourselves as a global technology provider for locker delivery solutions, predominantly focussing on the field service supply chain. This is an exciting departure from the previous market position as a distribution company with a strong technology capability. This change of position is allowing us to operate a different revenue model, through software subscriptions and licensing, rather than through logistics services.

To support this, the software development department must deliver the correct short and long-term projects to enable that re-positioning.

The Position

As a Software Development Manager at ByBox your duties include:

Leadership. Lead, motivate and influence a team of expert software developers to deliver value for ByBox while ensuring software quality. Ensure the developers have all the tools they need, be it hardware, software, or training, to do their job to the required level.

Relationships. Work closely with colleagues in the software development department to ensure the development team are aligned to business priorities and strategy. Develop strong relationships with internal customers to understand their perspectives and to positively influence the reputation of software development.

Recruitment. Take a highly pro-active role in the recruitment of software developers. Work with the ByBox recruitment team to ensure the highest-quality candidates are identified and engaged effectively. Also, engage with external organisations to seek the right talent and to promote ByBox as a forward-thinking employer of software developers.

Resourcing. Work closely with the Business Interface Manager and Project Managers to ensure the right developers are available at the right time for delivering the Software Development Pipeline. Where necessary, own the relationship with outsourced-development teams and the process for bringing on additional software developers on a temporary-contract basis. Ensure the software developers are appropriately assigned to projects, and given opportunities to work on other projects as required and fairly. Respond to business needs through the appropriate deployment of developers, while protecting long-term contingency in capacity so we can quickly respond to opportunities.

People development. Develop and retain our people by fostering a positive environment for personal and professional development through continuously engaging with developers, appraisals, objectives and training plans. Provide a platform for developers to raise concerns or offer new ideas, support one another, and resolve conflict, and where necessary manage performance or disciplinary concerns. Promote and develop the key values from our Ways of Working, including innovation, trust and openness.

Continuous improvement. Drive continuous improvement and adoption of best practices within the software development team to optimize the performance of the team. By pragmatically weighing the business need for delivery with the need to keeping technology current, help to ensure the team is producing the right solution at the right time.

Documentation. Define and own the good practice for technical documentation, demos, and handovers amongst the team for the benefit of colleagues, and customers requiring technical API documentation.

Technology. Support your team in ensuring they are abreast of the latest developments in technologies, and they have the tools they need to adopt appropriate technology. Be familiar with the current technologies in your team, and be aware of upcoming technologies. You do not need to be the technology expert within your team, but must be able to articulate the pros and cons of competing technologies and justify investment to senior management.

Quality Assurance. Work very closely with the Quality Assurance Manager to ensure QA practices are aligned across the department, particularly in the adoption of Test Automation and the Test Automation Engineers reporting to the QA Manager.

Workload. Manage your own objectives and priorities effectively and without close supervision. Although you won't be directly managing the work of your direct reports (this will be done by Software Project Managers), a good awareness of their current work will be crucial in making good decisions. You will be able to escalate issues to the Head of R&D and will also be required to make recommendations. You will also be involved in the technology strategy by supporting the Head of R&D with departmental planning activities as required.

The Person

The Software Development manager does not need to be currently active in writing code, and the role does not entail any code-writing, but there is room for a successful candidate to define the level of their technical involvement, based on their knowledge. The ideal candidate will:

  • Have a passion for Technology and good understanding of trends in Software Development.
  • Have a strong technical foundation in Software Development.
  • Embrace a cross-functional approach to team management and appreciate the challenges therein.
  • Foster an open, collaborative environment, and balance people's needs with company objectives.
  • Appreciate the challenges of managing a team of home-workers, and home-working yourself.
  • Understand how to lead and manage a team of highly talented, distributed Software Developers.

Essential qualifications and experience:

  • Team Leadership or Management, particularly teams of Software Developers
  • Technical background.
  • Worked with home-working or distributed teams.
  • Management of outsourced development partners.
  • Excellent command of written and spoken English.

Desirable qualifications and experience:

  • Experience working in a team of primarily .Net & JavaScript developers.
  • Experience in the logistics industry.
  • Knowledge of the ByBox domain

About ByBox

ByBox is leading the way in box-based logistics. Electronic box networks are doing to distribution what ATM's did to retail banking: Increased service, reduced cost.

ByBox uses its World-beating electronic box technology as a platform for the most sophisticated field service solution in the UK. ByBox is also the only UK supplier of box-based consumer solutions to the global postal market.

As one of the fastest growing technology companies in the UK, ByBox boasts an impressive software development team. Their current suite of mobile, client and web-based applications cover:

·Mobile Apps

·Bluetooth & Electronic lock-box integration

·Customer-facing web applications

·EDI & Customer integration

·Transport & distribution management

·Warehouse management

·Label and barcode generation

·Administrative services

·…and much more

Benefits

Home-based working for most of the Technology team
Flexible working hours
High-end kit provided including all software tools required
Training and development budget provided
25 days leave a year rising to 30 days
Several offices in UK and travel expenses covered

items.title: Head of Growth
items.content:
About Find My Larp

Find My Larp is a global online marketplace for Live Action Role Playing (Larp) events.

The global Larp event market is estimated to be worth £500m per year in ticket sales alone, and we are on a mission to create the first Marketplace of it’s kind for this industry. We launched our MVP in late October 2017 and have already sold tickets and got early traction. We’ve also managed to attracted a good number of users on both the supply & demand side.

Our small founding team is made of Larp industry experts and experienced tech industry founders. The team is spread out between London and Stockholm and we mostly work remotely.

Learn more at www.findmylarp.com

Role Objectives

We are looking for a Head of Growth who will be responsible for developing and executing marketing & business development plans. In practice, the role will be a hybrid of a marketer and business development.

The Head of Growth will, first and foremost, be a growth hacker, able to think strategically about approaches, methodologies, indicators, and metrics, and define the relevant growth KPIs, on the one hand; and, on the other, personally deploying all available tools and techniques, using whatever tactics are suitable – and with minimal budget – to drive product adoption and usage. This will include ongoing experimentation and continuous optimisation through testing and tuning.

Effective growth hacking will necessitate a deep understanding of the drivers of engagement and virality within products, and the Head of Growth will work closely with the rest of the team to optimise the end-to-end user/customer experience.

The role will also be responsible for the management and utilisation of user/customer data across all touch points, ensuring that the right infrastructure, systems and people are in place to support effective data-driven decision making.
The role is absolutely critical for Find My Larp – and you will be able to significantly influence whether or not Find My Larp is able to reach it’s full potential in the quickest time possible.. This is a career-defining opportunity to; help build a brand new business from the ground up in an industry which is on the cusp of becoming mainstream and hugely popular.

Profile Overview

The ideal candidate will be…

…an experienced growth hacker with a stellar track record of driving exponential growth in usage and engagement, across multiple markets, for a new internet businesses.

…intelligent, creative, bold and daring, but at the same time highly data-driven and analytical. They will be highly commercial, with a good understanding of growth metrics and KPIs, and strong instincts for where the greatest gains, at the fastest speed, may be made. They will be an expert in the use of social media and features to drive virality and growth.

…equally comfortable with high-level, strategic thinking, and hands-on implementation, with close attention to detail. He or she will have a strong bias to action, able to work at a very fast pace, and comfortable making quick decisions.

…naturally intellectually curious and unafraid to take risks, willing to try non-traditional approaches to achieve goals relish new challenges and learning new things; and enjoy conducting experiments and testing hypotheses.

…a bold, ambitious and creative individual who genuinely wants to challenge the status quo. They will have no tolerance for mediocrity and will constantly be raising the bar. They will have a collaborative, open style that fosters participation and widespread contribution of ideas.

Summary of Required Experience & Attributes:

GROWTH MARKETING EXPERIENCE – Will be an accomplished and experienced growth hacker, with a track record of driving user/customer growth and engagement for online businesses. It is expected that this person will be hands-on familiar with paid search and social marketing (Google & Facebook in particular).

PRODUCT SENSIBILITY / APPRECIATION FOR ENGAGING CONSUMER PRODUCTS – Will have a good understanding of UX, and experience of working hand-in glove with product management. Will understand drivers of engagement and virality.

BOTH STRATEGIC AND EXECUTION-FOCUSED – Will be able to think ‘big picture’ and take a strategic perspective, but have a strong bias to action, with a hands-on, implementation-oriented approach.

RELATIONSHIP AND COMMUNICATION SKILLS – Will be capable of operating successfully with small teams and able to scale them as needed. Will be an inspiring and engaging communicator and colleague, able to build positive working relationships with ease.

CULTURE FIT – Entrepreneurial, passionate, friendly, low-ego, collaborative, fast-paced, transparent, creative, challenging, high integrity, down to earth.

Benefits

Find My Larp is a very early stage (pre-funding) start up and as such the perks on offer are limited. The biggest benefit we can current offer is opportunity to take a fledgling company (with huge potential) to it’s full potential.

As the Head of Growth you will have the ability to shape the direction of the company and if successful will reap the rewards along the way. For the right candidate we can offer an attractive equity package of between 10-20% as well as performance related bonuses and profit sharing opportunities.

Flexible working conditions come as part of the package, so you can pick when and where you work from.


Application Method

Send us an email (via work-in-startups) with your CV and a short letter outlining why you feel you're the right person for the job and will get back to you within 3 business days.

*We are not working with any staffing firms or agencies and will not be accepting resumes from them.

items.title: Remote Year: Program Associate, Program Placement Team
items.content:
Program Associate, Program Placement Team

Posted Nov 14

Remote Year
Headquarters: Remote
https://remote-year.breezy.hr/p/7179e03b059c

Remote Year brings together communities of interesting professionals, entrepreneurs, and freelancers from across the globe to spend a year working, traveling, and exploring 12 cities around the world.  Spending one month in each location, communities connect with local cultures and business ecosystems, forming lifelong, borderless personal and professional relationships along the way.  Together we will shape the future of work.

Role:

Remote Year is looking for personable and intelligent sale focused Program Associates to join our Program Placement Team. Our Program Associates are the first touch in our consultative sales process. They are the responsible for qualifying applicants and helping them decide if Remote Year is the right match for them. Working alongside our team of Program Associates you will critically support our Program Consultants by helping potential Remotes through the early stages of our program placement process.

What You Bring:

  • 1-2 years of experience exceeding quota in Sales Development, Lead Generation, Sales, Recruiting, or Marketing, with preference to consumer sales.

  • Ability to work in a high-energy and distributed sales team environment.

  • Highly coachable, self-directed, positive, motivated, and resourceful.

  • Incredible customer service, excellent listening skills, and strong writing skills.

  • Passion for learning and working within the travel space.

items.title: Cables & Sensors: IT Project Manager, Background in Web Development, APIs or Shopify
items.content:
Full-time

(Anywhere - Work will be done remotely)

Who We Are

Cables & Sensors is a highly efficient, fast-growing company that manufactures and distributes accessories for the medical industry in the US and Europe. Although being a small company, we have been awarded with the prestigious Inc 500 Fastest Growing Private Companies in America, ranking at number 377. We are a group of young, smart, perfectionists who love what we do and are proud of being very different from other companies in our industry. We are a high-tech, e-commerce company with a distributed workforce allowing us to work remotely, from our homes of where we most enjoy spending our time. Because we have built an incredibly efficient and organized business, we are very selective about who we hire. If you make it in, we promise you will love working with us.

Summary/Objective

This position will assist the IT Director with daily activities including managing web development teams for current and future projects as well as managing our API-based workflow automation running multiple web applications including Shopify. This role will be responsible for maintaining and writing software specification documents, documenting processes, managing projects and basic coding. This position requires a high level of organization, creativity and excellent communication with a wide variety of people. It also requires the ability to properly manage time and prioritize as well as making many decisions and/or know when to consult others on them. This person must have prior experience managing development projects be very comfortable with web technologies such as API connections and the Shopify platform.

Essential Functions

  1. Interacting with external development teams who are developing Cables and Sensors’ IT projects, answering questions and resolving requests

  2. Writing detailed, high-quality specification documentation for new developments

  3. Writing low to mid-level code to maintain current developments, perhaps adding new basic features that can be done in-house

  4. Exploring and identifying new tools and solutions for existing problems or improving current technology

  5. QA testing

  6. Managing timelines for various projects and keeping the teams well informed, coordinated and on schedule

Competencies

  1. Technical capacity to understand complex web developments involving APIs, front end technologies and databases.

  2. Capability to understand and write API documentation

  3. Thoroughness, the candidate must be detailed oriented and capable of following complex projects until their completion.

  4. Time management, capability to prioritize important tasks and manage large volumes of data.

  5. Communication proficiency, capability to easily communicate with remote teams by phone and email.

  6. Self-driven, motivated and capable of managing his or her own time and work.

Supervisory Responsibility

This position will supervise external, remote development teams.

Work Environment

This job is a remote position. All office and computer equipment required to perform its duties will be provided by C&S. A dedicated, quiet location with a strong internet connection at home will be required for this position.

Our team’s management style is very hands off. Each team member knows their responsibilities and has lots of freedom to do the job how they consider best. Because of this (and our remote style of working), excellent communication is very important within the team. With the high level of freedom comes an equal dose of responsibility.

 

Position Type/Expected Hours of Work

This is a full-time position, and hours of work and days are Monday through Friday, 8:30AM to 5PM EST. Occasional evening and weekend work may be required as job duties demand. If working from a timezone different of US Eastern Standard Time, after a few months of training, independence of working hours can be achieved.

Pace of work is regularly quite high. This does not mean we expect the candidate to be overworked, but rather focused and productive during working hours. We believe that an employee produces best when they have a healthy balance of work and rest (social life, hobbies, family, free time). There will be times when deadlines are at hand and working long hours and weekends will be necessary, as there will also be slow periods when time can be taken off to compensate and take care of self.

Travel

A couple yearly trips might be required to train or work on-site with other team members.

Required Experience

Pre-requisites:

  1. 3+ years experience in development such as Javascript, Ruby on Rails, Shopify or API development

  2. 2+ years experience managing web development projects

  3. Experience with time management tools such as Trello, Bugherd, Asana, Slack, Google Docs

  4. Experience managing multiple, complex, continuous IT projects

  5. Experience writing software documentation

Nice-to-haves:

  1. Basic to medium experience developing APIs and Shopify

  2. Experience managing various IT consultants

  3. Medium to advanced experience with databases

  4. Familiarity with agile project management techniques

Other Duties

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice. Because C&S is a small, young company, it will be expected, from time to time, for every position in the company to perform tasks that are beyond their job description.

Reports to

Andres Orjuela, IT Director
