items.title: InVisionApp: Internal Tools Manager
items.content:
Internal Tools Manager

Posted Nov 10

InVisionApp
Headquarters: New York, NY
https://www.invisionapp.com

InVision is the world’s leading design collaboration platform.

 

We enable companies of all sizes to discover the power of design-driven product development. That’s why more than 2,000,000 designers, product managers, marketers and other stakeholders at so many of the world's most loved startups, agencies, & corporations use InVision every day, including Uber, Evernote, Twitter, Adobe, Salesforce and many more.

 

Our Internal Tooling team strives to develop and maintain high quality, scalable tools and integrations, leveraged by User Enablement, Support, Sales, Training, and other teams. Candidates should be excited at the prospect of serving those teams who so faithfully serve our customers everyday.

Requirements

  • THE CHOPS: You describe yourself as a jack-of-all-trades, thoroughly experienced and excited by modern technologies and services. You are a leader who manages through example and prides themselves on organization and results.
  • PASSIONATE ABOUT DESIGN: You understand that design makes everything possible. You are able to distinguish ‘great’ design from ‘pretty’ design. You see the difference design thinking can make in the lives of users. And you understand that even something as historically unpolished as internal tools deserve topnotch UX.
  • PROBLEM SOLVER: You enjoy learning how to solve problems in the most efficient way possible. Complexity doesn’t scare you. The challenge of distilling something complex into something simple invigorates and excites you.
  • BIASED TOWARD ACTION: You are a self-motivated, action-oriented person. You don’t sit on your hands and wait for someone else to fix a problem. If there is something you can do to make a situation better, you do it.
  • FOLLOWS THROUGH: From support staff, to product designers, to engineering – you speak the language of each of these archetypes. You are empathetic, concise, and consistent in your communication and follow-through. You ensure that the team own their commitments, collectively and personally.
  • PLAYS WELL WITH OTHERS: You recognize the strengths of your teammates and understand that we will only get where we want to go if we work together. You work with leadership to place team members on projects appropriate to their skill level and team needs.

Your Experience

  • 5+ years of experience in Product or Engineering Management (or a similar) role.
  • Experience as the direct manager of software engineers in an agile, startup environment.
  • Strong problem solving and decision-making ability, with a breadth of experience in both client-side and server-side technologies.
  • Strong proficiency preferably in Node.js; solid professional experience in one of the following backend languages: Java, Ruby, Python, PHP also preferred.
  • Preference for working in rapid development cycles (2-4 weeks).
  • Familiarity with common tools like Git, Jira, Confluence, Jenkins/CI.
  • Experience with Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery environments.
  • A proven track record of success in working with product managers, engineers, and various stakeholders to accomplish great things.
  • Familiar with modern security best practices, solutions, and technologies.
  • Understanding of the technical implications of complex and highly scalable applications.
  • The ability to dive right into a big project and manage it from start to finish.
  • Ability to thrive in a variable and demanding startup environment.
  • Comfortable in a native design environment (Sketch, Photoshop, etc.) and have a good grasp on the tools that are representative of the industry.

Responsibilities

  • You will manage a small -- yet very talented! -- team of engineers to deliver and maintain your products. Leadership responsibilities will aim to consume 20% of your time, with the remainder (80%) dedicated to frontline development.
  • You will be the internal subject matter expert and product owner for our Internal Tooling team, responsible for designing, developing, and sustaining a suite of tools and systems integrations.
  • You will manage the roadmap, refining feature ideas and maintaining existing features to drive business goals and ensure that the needs of your internal customers are being met.
  • Engage stakeholders in leadership, data, support, sales, and engineering and translate their needs into requirements for the various projects you'll oversee.
  • Coordinate across teams to maintain product and strategy alignment.
  • Invest in team growth and morale to build not just a product, but a team.
  • Adjust role specializations, process definitions, and other factors to improve scope control, quality, and velocity.
 

Benefits

InVision offers an incredibly unique work environment. The company employs a diverse team all over the world. In the United States we have teams including hubs in New York, San Francisco, Austin, Portland, and Boston. Each InVision team member is given the freedom and tools to do their best work from wherever they choose. Among our benefits we offer competitive health plans, 401k, a flexible vacation policy, unlimited Starbucks cards for each employee, and unlimited books related to your profession.

 

InVision is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Apply for this position

items.title: Senior Engineering Manager @ npm
items.content:
Senior Engineering Manager @ npm

2017-11-09 03:47

Description

npm is the world's largest software repository, with over 10 million users and over 13 billion downloads every month. Our engineering team builds software and services that have become essential to modern JavaScript development, and are used by every company that builds websites.

We are looking for someone who has worked with teams at startups before. You'll make sure your team members are supported, and aid communication both within your team and with other teams. You'll understand the company's business goals and pro-actively align your team's tasks and priorities to match. You'll have experience hiring engineers, and helping them grow in experience and responsibility as a company evolves.

You have a background as an experienced engineer who exemplifies our engineering culture: flexible, pragmatic, communicative, and empathetic. You won't be writing production code, but we'll expect you to understand the software your team is building to a degree where you can meaningfully assist in architectural and implementation decisions, both by drawing on your own experience and providing the broader perspective on company goals that your position will give you.

Leaders at npm are evaluated based on the success of their team. Your success in this role means pushing authority to information, mentoring your team to continually improve their skill, building trust for each other and for their colleagues, and adapting processes as necessary to execute on our mission. We believe that having to tell people exactly what to do indicates a failure mode.

Our team is distributed across locations and timezones, so you must be comfortable with remote work and asynchronous communication patterns. Slack is the hub of all of our workflows, so your skill with textual communication is essential.

npm is an engineering-centric company and its engineering practices and culture are important to us. In this position you’ll have a chance to influence that culture and help us live up to our values. We emphasize collaboration and thoughtful iteration on our processes as well as our code. We feel that people do their best work when in emotionally safe environments and in their best physical health, and our management team is tasked with creating the culture that makes this possible. Our wish is that we can enable everyone at npm to do the best work of their careers thus far, and set them up to do even better work after npm.

The work your team will be doing is vital to all of npm’s product plans. It will affect the daily work of millions of JavaScript developers worldwide. If you want to lead an engineering team at the company that has revolutionized web development, this is the job for you.

We will be accepting applicants for this position through Monday, Nov 27, 2017.

About working here

You will most likely be working out of our headquarters in Oakland, California. While many of our team members are spread out around the globe, we will have a preference for local applicants, as this job will be easier with direct real-time communication with a majority of our team. We are open to considering experienced remote candidates, however! We cannot currently sponsor new work visas other than TN-1s, but we can transfer existing H-1Bs.

npm is not a typical early-stage “work hard/play hard” startup. We are responsible adults with diverse backgrounds and interests, who take our careers and our lives seriously. The best way to iterate towards success is by taking care of ourselves, our families, our users, and one another.

We aim for a sustainable approach to work and life, because that is the best way to maximize long-term speed, while retaining clarity of vision. Compassion is our strategy.

Country

Anywhere

items.title: Exciting Business Development Manager Opportunity
items.content:
About us
At Trail, we're on a mission to make operations effortless for everyone.


Most of us use hospitality, retail and other service-sector businesses every day. Many of us will have had a job working in these sectors at some point. It’s about long hours, tough work and is run on old-fashioned admin tools. At Trail (trailapp.com), we're trying to change that.

We’re a passionate team of 15 with a Moorgate office. After 2 years achieving product-market fit, we're now looking for enthusiastic, charismatic and passionate people ready to take us into the next stage of growth.

Overview
As Business Development Manager you will work with the Head of Business Development prospecting, qualifying and generating new sales leads. You should be a highly motivated, self-starter. Able to identify and develop new business prospects from multiple sources including inbound marketing leads, prospect lists, discovery and individual research.


The Business Development Manager is expected to:
Develop new business via telephone, email and social media to introduce Trail to prospective clients/partners and identify appropriate buyers within the target market.
Follow up on leads and conduct research to identify potential prospects.
Conduct a needs analysis and determine pain points to build a solid business case
Identify key buying influencers within these prospects to determine budget and timeline.
Build and cultivate prospect relationships by initiating communications, meeting clients and conducting follow-up communications in order to move opportunities through the sales funnel.
Work with the Head of Business Development to develop and grow the sales
pipeline to consistently meet company goals.
Manage data for new and prospective clients in Trail’s CRM tool, ensuring all communications are logged, information is accurate and documents are attached.

Requirements
Experience in hospitality, retail or leisure industry preferred
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
London based but we do offer remote working at least one day per week


Technical Experience
Understanding of Cloud-based technology
Experience with CRM Software preferred.

Package
Competitive salary
33 days holiday per annum
Equity in company
MacBook and Phone
Great career progression opportunities
A great working culture, remote work, trips abroad, work outings and fun!

Due to the high volume of applicants we have received for this role we are unable to respond to all applications, if you have not heard back from us within 14 days then unfortunately your application has been unsuccessful on this occasion.

Job Description

We are a bootstrap looking for an experienced VP of Sales, someone who has real startup or small business experience carrying the bag. We are NOT looking for an order taker. Evangelical selling - and clear evidence of ability to do so - required. Prior experience in selling to global investment entities such as banks, hedge funds or brokerages required. Proven ability to operate in other markets (or at least the ability to hire and manage salespeople in other markets) highly desired. International experience desirable, but not strictly necessary.

At our CEO's prior company, Cataphora, the top salespeople had W-2's of $700K+ in a good year. Because we too are a bootstrap, we offer the unusual combination of real commissions and much higher than average equity cut for the right person. For the same reason, we have a very sales-oriented culture. If you are a top-notch salesperson who has always wanted to work in a startup but at the same time need to work in the context of a "real business" we are likely the place for you.

The ideal candidate will be in NYC or London, but other locations would be considered for the right person. In the US, we offer premium medical insurance as well as dental and vision.

items.title: 100% Remote Migrations Manager at Filevine LLC (Provo, UT) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Enterprise Software, Law Firms
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

The problem that I want you to solve...

We are a fast growing software company building highly customizable SaaS products.  When we close new customers, those customer have legacy systems full of data of varying quality that they want moved to our system.  Since our system is highly customizable, some of that is repeatable and some are one off migrations.

I need a person that could manage a staff of technical people, but also can make the customer experience good one.  Setting customer expectations, creating repeatable processes, dealing with internal and external people.  That will require a firm hand and the ability to say "no.".  We currently have a backlog of customers not yet onboarded and sales are ramping up.  This is currently a weak point in our operation and we need a person that can make this into a strength.  

Challenges include varying data quality in legacy system, varying cooperation from new customer, commitments are important because new customers often have to cease operations on legacy systems and start on Filevine, creating a relatively small window, managing late process requests for changes - all of the usual migration issues.  Key is finding the balance in all of this.  No customer wants or will pay for perfect data but we want them happy at the end.  That can be a moving target.

Skills & Requirements

Ability to manage a technical operation and staff - this often means a technical background

Ability to navigate the balance between pleasing customers and letting them take advantage

Ability to setup processes that are reliable

Ability to set and meet commitments

Ability to properly set expectations properly

About Filevine LLC

Filevine is a private software company with a product that helps law firms manage their practices.  Filevine has two physical locations in Provo, UT and Las Vegas, NV for sales and support.    

Benefits

100% Remote Work
Jerk-free Environment
Normal stuff like Health Insurance, Paid Time Off and 401K

items.title: UI Engineering Manager- Leading Open Source Company at Elastic () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Lead, Manager
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Data & Analytics, Search, Software Development / Engineering
Company size: 501-1k people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

With Elastic's continued growth, we are looking for a talented, attentive Engineering Manager to propel and guide our team. Do you feel at home nurturing the success of dynamic, wold class engineers? Are you a top Software Engineering Managers who want to support and lead engineers on Kibana and X-Pack, robust tools which allow visual exploration, real-time data analysis in addition to other powerful features, all while working on core frontend applications? Than we want to meet you.

If you read this far and think, “that's me!” then you probably won't need to read any further and we should have a conversation. But if you are in any doubt the type of experiences we expect you to have then the following should help clarify;

Please include a short note as to wire you are a fit for Elastic and this role

Kibana is the window into the Stack

Kibana lets users visualize their Elasticsearch data and navigate the Elastic Stack, so they can do anything from learning why they’re getting paged at 2:00 a.m. to understanding the impact rain might have on their quarterly numbers. Kibana gives users the freedom to select the way they give craft to their data. And they don’t always have to know what they’re looking for. With its interactive visualizations, users start with one question and see where it leads them. Kibana core ships with the classics: histograms, line graphs, pie charts, sunbursts, and more. They demonstrate the full aggregation capabilities of Elasticsearch.

Engineering Philosophy

Engineering a highly complex distributed system that is easy to operate via elegantly designed APIs is a non-trivial effort. It requires solid software development skills, and more importantly, a sharp mind and the ability to think like a user. We also care deeply about giving you full ownership of what you’re working on. Our company fundamentally believes great minds achieve greatness when they are set free and are surrounded and challenged by their peers, which is clearly visible in our organization. At Elastic, we effectively don’t have a hierarchy to speak of. We feel that anyone needs to be in the position to comment on absolutely anything, regardless of his or her role within the company.

What you will be doing:

  • Day to day management of 10-15 engineers
  • Hiring and recruiting of new staff
  • Performance management, reviews and quarterly feedback for the team
  • Expense management and approval
  • Vacation and time off management and approval
  • Project management and prioritization support for the team
  • Management of roadmaps and requirements against release targets

What you've done:

  • 3+ years of software engineering management
  • Recent experience leading teams producing complex interactive web experiences
  • An engineering background with a B.S. or equivalent in a Software Engineering related domain
  • Experience leading distributed teams
  • Experience leading an open source product team
  • Familiarity with JavaScript and one or more UI framework: AngularJS, React, Node.js etc...

About Elastic

Elastic is the world's leading software provider for making structured and unstructured data usable in real time for search, logging, security, and analytics use cases. Founded in 2012 by the people behind the Elasticsearch, Kibana, Beats, and Logstash open source projects, Elastic's global community has more than 80,000 members across 45 countries, and since its initial release. Elastic's products have achieved more than 100 million cumulative downloads. Today thousands of organizations, including Cisco, eBay, Dell, Goldman Sachs, Groupon, HP, Microsoft, Netflix, The New York Times, Uber, Verizon, Yelp, and Wikipedia, use the Elastic Stack, X-Pack, and Elastic Cloud to power mission-critical systems that drive new revenue opportunities and massive cost savings. Elastic is backed by more than $104 million in funding from Benchmark Capital, Index Ventures, and NEA; has headquarters in Amsterdam, the Netherlands, and Mountain View, California; and has over 400 employees in more than 30 countries around the world.

Additional Information

  • Competitive pay and benefits
  • Stock options
  • Catered lunches, snacks, and beverages in most offices
  • An environment in which you can balance great work with a great life
  • Passionate people building great products
  • Employees with a wide variety of interests
  • Your age is only a number. It doesn't matter if you're just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.

Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.

Benefits

401k Matching Up to 6 % in US and Pensions in some other countries
Health Care Insurance
Vacation Time Determined By Location
Lunch and Breakfast in Most Offices
100% Remote work possible

items.title: Engineering Manager at Formstack (Indianapolis, IN) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Industry: Information Technology, SaaS, Web Technology
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Formstack, the most flexible and powerful form building application, is looking for an Engineering Manager to add to its already awesome Dev team!

Formstack is an 11 year old company with its roots in Indianapolis. Our customers span 110 different countries, and our employees live and work across the U.S. and the globe. We provide a remote work environment that is flexible and provides great freedom for those who can perform.

What You Will Do:

You will work directly with the product managers and product design leads to help scope and hand off product features to the development team. Responsibilities include tracking team performance, setting and meeting goals, managing expectations, and delivering software on a deadline.

The majority of this role will be to manage people, projects and timelines. You should have an understanding of software development and be comfortable helping out when needed.

Who You Are:

You are a great leader, listener, decision maker, and can think on your feet. You believe people should lead by example. You have great attention to detail and enjoy keeping track of the who, what, when, where, and why. Constantly thinking about how to improve the development process keeps you up at night. You put your team ahead of yourself and try to do what's best for all parties involved. You aren't scared to make mistakes and try new things to achieve your objectives. You are comfortable not always knowing the answer and without a doubt a great communicator.

Who We Are:

We are a group of people who care about our customers and our teammates. We love what we do and what it means to our clients. Relationships are very important to us and we strive to create an environment where you can solve problems creatively and be yourself. We enjoy posting gifs (hard G) to Slack, playing Overwatch, eating lunch on camera (remote lunch get-togethers) and supporting each other. We believe strongly in a work/life balance and letting teams make their own decisions.

Requirements

  • Demonstrated success  working in a development environment
  • Proven success as a team lead or similar position
  • Comfortable managing a team of up to 6-8 developers and QA Analysts (we work in x-functional teams)
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Comfortable with agile methodologies & scrum
  • Proven ability to manage a remote team of software developers
  • Strong experience with PHP, Python, MySQL, Angular and JavaScript
  • Passion for quality. Code coverage with unit tests should be as complete as possible. Strive for performance and correctness.

Extra Credit

  • Experience working and managing teams over multiple time zones
  • Experience using JIRA or similar software

What Formstack Offers:

  • Remote environment
  • Medical, Dental, Vision as well as company-paid Disability and Life Insurance Benefits.
  • 401k with matching company contribution
  • Friday Lunch (Indianapolis Office)
  • The most up-to-date technology, including company-issued Macs, the latest software and other tools needed to excel at your job
  • Company-paid conferences and extended learning
  • Yearly company gatherings
  • Generous PTO

Want to learn more about who we are and what we value? Check out this Video and apply if you want to jump into the next great chapter of your life!

Benefits

The most up-to-date software
401k Safe Harbor Match
Lunch everyday paid for by Formstack (for employees in Indianapolis)
Generous PTO policy
Remote working office
All the snacks you can handle
Company-contributions to HSA
Monthly company "fun"
Yearly team-building event for the whole company
All the pings and pongs you can handle!

items.title: Director, Data Science & Insights at Achievement Network (Boston, MA) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Data Scientist
Industry: Education, Non-Profit
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Location:  Flexible (Boston, MA or New England region preferred)

Position available: November 2017

THE OPPORTUNITY

We are seeking a Director to join the Organizational  Effectiveness (OE) team.  The OE team ensures that ANet has the right goals that motivate and drive us to achieve our mission, spearheads our shared organizational focus on improving our core service model, and builds a research mindset and capability across ANet’s internal teams. This role reports to the Vice President, Org Effectiveness and is the ideal position for someone who has a passion for growing an organization’s confident use of data in order to shape strategic decisions and to deepen its long-term impact.

ANet is flexible to remote working, with occasional travel to ANet’s National Office in Boston. Therefore, proximity to the New England area and/or eastern time zone is preferable.

WHAT YOU’LL DO

Examine our organizational impact on school performance and hone our organizational focus on impacting school practice

  • Lead organization-wide school and student learning impact reporting against annual goals  
      • Manage complex analyses to extract new insights and year-over-year data patterns that convey a clear, compelling picture of ANet’s national impact over time
      • Convey results on goals in a way that is user-friendly and compelling for internal teams  and that can be used for external generalist audiences (i.e. impact statements)
      • Leverage strong visualizations and presentations to boost end user (primarily senior leadership & marketing/business development teams) comprehension of national impact results
  • Lead impact analyses that test and improve ANet’s core service model
    • Execute organization-wide annual analyses that identify the relationships between state assessment outcomes (student and school performance) and internal practice with inputs data sources (school demographic data, school practice data, partner school survey data, etc.)
    • Conduct complex analyses to  extract relevant findings/insights and year-over-year data patterns to share with senior leadership tied to 2020 strategic plan and impact vision
    • Partner closely with key business leads to identify annual prioritized research questions, drawing from prior years’ results, annual strategic goals, and ongoing learning agenda priorities
  • Lead reporting and analysis of ANet’s evolving non-core service model offerings to assess impact

Lead long-cycle learning on ANet’s core service model, primarily via mix of data collection and analytic improvement strategies

  • Lead data characterization and analyses of newer ANet data sources to deepen ANet’s ability to test and improve its core service model
    • Lead exploratory analyses of school partner data to produce new, actionable findings that accelerate improving ANet’s core service model and other service offerings
    • In collaboration with other OE team members and internal clients, set key research questions
    • Partner with key internal product and program teams to finalize use cases and baseline set definitions, metrics, and modes of analyses
    • Define reporting requirements for Engineering team
    • Examine and conduct feasibility checks of data in Google Analytics and identify and establish business and analytic rules for using tools such as unSampler
    • Explore opportunities with the Engineering team to identify longer-term data storage and cloud solutions

WHO YOU ARE & WHAT YOU BRING

Must Have:

  • You have prior experience and success designing and leading internal program evaluations and/or business intelligence projects for scaling organizations.
  • You bring proficiency and versatility with Excel and at least one statistical analysis software package (R, SAS, Stata, or SPSS) and are confident in advising others on matching the right analytic tool to the analytic task at hand.
  • You are optimistic that all of our schools can be successful if we learn together and that comes through in your facility with analyzing information and communicating complex findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • You bring proficiency with data visualization software (i.e. Tableau) and website usage analytics and software tools (Google Analytics).
  • You are motivated by working in an environment where we live out our core values daily and are eager to examine personal archetypes and biases while discussing topics related to race, class, and privilege which relate to ANet’s Advance Equity and People Matter values

Nice to Have:

  • Prior experience in a school, education, or non-profit setting
  • Degree in quantitative field, program evaluation, analytics, or statistics
  • Proficiency with unSampler
  • SQL proficiency

ANet is committed to maximizing the diversity of our organization. We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage individuals of all ethnic and racial backgrounds and gender identities to apply to our positions.

About Achievement Network

Achievement Network (ANet) is a nonprofit dedicated to educational equity. We help schools boost student learning with great teaching that’s grounded in standards, informed by data, and built on the successful practices of educators around the country.

Founded in 2005, ANet now serves over 700 schools educating over 230,000 students in California, Colorado, Connecticut, District of Columbia, Illinois, Louisiana, Massachusetts, Michigan, New Jersey, New York, Ohio, and Tennessee. Our support has consistently helped our partner schools—both district and charter—achieve breakthrough results for their students. ANet has received multiple awards and recognitions, including a prestigious Investing In Innovation (i3) grant from the federal government in 2010, New Schools Venture Fund’s “Organization of the Year” in 2011, and The NonProfit Time’s “Best Nonprofits to Work For” in 2015 and 2016.

ANet is a dynamic, values driven, team-oriented organization that is committed to the growth and development of all staff members. Individuals who join ANet have the opportunity to join an exceptional team of colleagues committed to helping schools drive excellent teaching and learning by investing in each other and learning together.

WHAT WE OFFER

ANet offers highly competitive compensation based on prior experience and qualifications as well as comprehensive benefits in order to best support our people. Benefits we offer include: health, dental and vision insurance where ANet pays 80% of the cost of these benefits for employees and their families/domestic partner; 3 weeks of vacation (4 weeks after two years with ANet); 10 paid holidays with paid days off between the Christmas and New Year’s holidays; a paid floating holiday; paid sick & personal days; paid parental leave; retirement plan options; commuter benefits; tuition reimbursement;  flexible spending accounts; short and long-term disability coverage; and basic life and personal accident insurance.

Benefits

80% Health, Dental, Vision
3 Weeks Vacation
10 Paid Holidays
Paid Parental Leave
Retirement Plan Options
Flexible Spending Accounts
Short and Long-Term Disability Coverage
Basic Life and Personal Accident Insurance
Tuition Reimbursement
Commuter Benefits

items.title: Head of Support
items.content:
Hiya! We’re SkyVerge and we love eCommerce. Our products help merchants manage and grow their online stores, all the way from boutique corner shops to Fortune 500 retailers. We’re looking for a Head of Support to join our fully-distributed team who will improve our support team and processes across our entire suite of products.

Role

You’ll be focused on ensuring that our customer support across our products and the platforms we work with continues to meet our high standards, and is constantly improving. You’ll be coaching support and engineering team members on tone and process, doing everything from reviewing drafts, spot-reading replies, assisting in de-escalating difficult threads, to tracking and improving team metrics on replies, response times, and response quality.

We know that the best learning and understanding comes from hands-on experience, so you’ll also be rolling up your sleeves to assist with support and pre-sales questions across our product suite. We have over 70 different products, so you’re excited that there’s always something new to learn.

You’ll have the opportunity to dive in and question everything: is what we’re doing effective? How are we measuring success? What standards are we setting? How can we improve and unify process across all products we support? Are our tools supporting our goals?

We expect that our head of support will be pushing our team forward on customer service best-practices, impeccable tone and voice, accuracy in replies, great supporting documentation, maintaining an internal knowledge base, and overall ensuring that our organization’s support runs as efficiently and seamlessly as a Swiss watch. We have several amazing team members already supporting our customers every day; you’ll be working directly with them to take our support to new heights.

We expect you to work closely with our product and development teams to ensure we’re building great products, have solid feedback loops in place for further improvements, and that customers get the help they need while running their businesses.

You

You have a remarkable knack for understanding our customers’ problems, and working together with them to understand our products and resolve issues. You know good customer service comes from a place full of empathy, helpfulness, and friendliness. Your written communication is crystal-clear and representative of the standards our team should work towards.

You’re solutions-oriented, self-directed, curious, and love solving problems. No question is too difficult for you to research, critically evaluate current best-practices, then develop your own path forward for an optimal solution or potential improvements. You can do this on your own, or work with a team to drive a project forward. You question existing practices and seek out the “best” way to do things.

To succeed in this role, you’ll have:

  • excellent written communication and native-level English fluency. (Do you have proficiency in other languages? Tell us! We love being able to support customers in their native language.)
  • ability to thrive in a remote environment (along with a reliable internet connection).
  • above-average skills for reporting on and evaluating data & support metrics.
  • boundless curiosity and inquisitiveness for our products and how we can do things better.
  • high technical competency, such as ability to use FTP, launch a website from scratch, and understand software development in general.
  • proficiency with HTML / CSS.
  • experience writing technical documentation or guides.
  • experience in previous team captain or leadership roles.
  • experience in supporting software (downloadable or SaaS, we do both!).

    It’s helpful if you have:

  • experience with eCommerce, or with platforms we work with in particular (Shopify, WooCommerce, Easy Digital Downloads).
  • experience in building, fixing, or maintaining software (if you have PHP, JavaScript, Ruby, etc., skills, let us know).
  • previous experience working remotely.
  • are US or CA-based for maximum overlap with our existing support team.

    Our team is fully-remote and we communicate primarily through Slack, GitHub, Help Scout, and weekly stand-ups on Monday via Zoom (a few short meetings on Monday) — we believe the best work happens when given lots of uninterrupted time that’s free of distractions. That said, we believe face time is valuable — availability for 1-2 company-paid team trips (SkyTrip!) per year is necessary.
    This is a full-time, salaried position, but hours are flexible. We know your work will speak for itself with support metric improvements, documentation added, and wiki edits.

    Process

    Qualified candidates will get an email with a few questions to answer via email. Following that, you’ll have a few 30-minute phone chats with different people on our team to learn more about you and answer any questions you have about the position and company.

    If this goes well, we’ll invite you to join our team and start your 4-week trial. During this period, you’ll work full-time as a contractor, or part-time on nights/weekends if you already have a full-time position. This gives you an opportunity to make sure you enjoy the work and the team, and it gives us an opportunity to evaluate your work. We’ll have regular chats each week to share feedback and make sure we’re on the same page. At the end of the 4 weeks, you’ll be offered a permanent position

    Benefits

    Here are some benefits we're excited to offer to our team members:

  • Competitive salary
  • Annual incentive for meeting team and company goals
  • 25 days of paid time-off, in addition to 2 company holidays (SkyVerge Day in March, Founders Day in June )
  • Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance for US and Canadian residents and their families (reimbursements for comparable care for non-US/Canadian residents)
  • 401k/RRSP Retirement plan with 4% company match for US/Canadian residents (contributions to comparable plans for non-US/Canadian residents)
  • Work from anywhere that has a reliable internet connection
  • The tools (hardware/software) you need to be productive
  • Allowance for professional growth (books, courses, conferences)
  • Home office or co-working allowance
  • A Kindle to help you keep learning

    We support workplace diversity and do not discriminate on any protected class. We believe when we work together as a team of different views, experiences, and ideas, we can build amazing things.

Our team is fully-remote and we communicate primarily through Slack, GitHub, Help Scout, and weekly stand-ups on Monday via Zoom (a few short meetings on Monday) — we believe the best work happens when given lots of uninterrupted time that’s free of distractions. That said, we believe face time is valuable — availability for 1-2 company-paid team trips (SkyTrip!) per year is necessary.

This is a full-time, salaried position, but hours are flexible. We know your work will speak for itself with support metric improvements, documentation added, and wiki edits.

Process

Qualified candidates will get an email with a few questions to answer via email. Following that, you’ll have a few 30-minute phone chats with different people on our team to learn more about you and answer any questions you have about the position and company.

If this goes well, we’ll invite you to join our team and start your 4-week trial. During this period, you’ll work full-time as a contractor, or part-time on nights/weekends if you already have a full-time position. This gives you an opportunity to make sure you enjoy the work and the team, and it gives us an opportunity to evaluate your work. We’ll have regular chats each week to share feedback and make sure we’re on the same page. At the end of the 4 weeks, you’ll be offered a permanent position

Benefits

Here are some benefits we're excited to offer to our team members:

  • Competitive salary
  • Annual incentive for meeting team and company goals
  • 25 days of paid time-off, in addition to 2 company holidays (SkyVerge Day in March, Founders Day in June )
  • Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance for US and Canadian residents and their families (reimbursements for comparable care for non-US/Canadian residents)
  • 401k/RRSP Retirement plan with 4% company match for US/Canadian residents (contributions to comparable plans for non-US/Canadian residents)
  • Work from anywhere that has a reliable internet connection
  • The tools (hardware/software) you need to be productive
  • Allowance for professional growth (books, courses, conferences)
  • Home office or co-working allowance
  • A Kindle to help you keep learning

We support workplace diversity and do not discriminate on any protected class. We believe when we work together as a team of different views, experiences, and ideas, we can build amazing things.

Apply for this position

Apply directly via this link: https://skyverge.workable.com/jobs/600766. Applications accepted until November 17th.

items.title: e9digital: Project Manager/Website Producer
items.content:
Part-time

(Midtown Manhattan)

e9digital is one of the top rated digital agencies in Manhattan and NYC.

We have over 200 clients under management and produce 10+ projects at any one time.

We're seeking an experienced project manager to interface with our clients and manage our development teams to deliver on-time, on-budget projects.

Experience:
We are looking for a candidate that has a minimum of 3+ years experience and proven track record on dozens of website proejcts.

You must have great written and verbal communication skills, and have that soft touch that clients love.

Location:
Bacause of our banking clients' security requirements you must be a US Citizen located in the USA. You can work remotely since most of our meetings with clients and team are done via uberconference, but if you are in the NYC area, you can work at our Midtown studio if you want. 

Compensation:
We will pay an hourly rate commensurate with experience, so tell us what your rate is.

We pay staff and freelancers twice per month, so you'll never wait for your compensation with us.

We expect that you will have 20 to 30 hours per week at the start, and that could quickly grow to 40 hours per week.

Job Responsibilities:
1) Reports directly to the Creative Director and CEO
2) Serves as Leader of organizational processes, protocols, practices
3) Serves as point of contact for clients with new website/marketing projects as well as websites/projects in maintenance and/or maintenance requests.
4) Schedules, coordinates, and enforces all phases (from inception to completion) of new project/maintenance tasks with Creative Director, Production Team
5) Request/Source/Manage resources; measures the profitability of using resources. Management will approve or deny requested resources.
6) Leads regularly staff "stand-up" meetings/events covering "big picture" + production/scheduling details
7) Maintain/cultivate Expert level knowledge of web technology/best practices, digital industry developments
8) Provides ad hoc administrative support to designers, engineers, sales as schedule permits
9) Analyzes Internal Processes on ongoing basis to look for ways to improve efficiency, quality, team spirit
10) Documents all ongoing project/process intelligence for future reference

-- FOR NEW website/creative projects:
1) Gathers all Project Summary, other client background info from Sales
2) Creates Project Kickoff documentation containing all necessary, relevant background info
3) Schedules, co-leads (with Creative Director) Project Kickoff Meeting with Client + other pertinent personnel
4) Documents all meeting interactions, follows through with summary to client, CD; collects all assets necessary from client
5) Initiates internal Creative/Production brief document to be shared with Production Team
6) Creates Project schedule with checkpoints, Coordinates with CD to properly staff assigned production team
7) Schedules, co-leads (with Creative Director) Creative Presentation Meeting (follows through per #4)
8) Communicates regularly with Client, CD/Production Team to ensure scheduling milestones met
9) Facilitates content + tech production if skills/schedule permits
10) Manages website QA + site launch process; print production proof/fulfillment process, plus all other media fulfillment process
11) Trains clients on basic WordPress editing/content management

-- FOR MAINTENANCE tasks/requests:
1) Documents, analyzes, parses all client's new projects and maintenance requests before assigning to production team.
2) For simple WordPress updates, offers advice and/or assistance to the client.
3) For more complex tasks, confers with CD and/or engineer to evaluate best approach (may mean pushing back on client request)
4) Manages QA, task fulfillment

Apply:

items.title: Engineering Manager, Observability Team @ Etsy
items.content:
Engineering Manager, Observability Team @ Etsy

2017-10-23 03:21

Description

Etsy is seeking an Engineering Manager to join our team.

As Etsy grows, the technical infrastructure and platforms need to continue to enable Etsy's growth while providing innovative ways to improve our systems. The Observability team is tasked with making that happen for all metrics, logging and alerting needs and we're looking for someone to manage this team.

Etsy is actively preparing to move systems to a cloud provider, and this team play a key role in this work. This is an exciting and revolutionary time to join Etsy as engineering embarks on its next generation work, offering an opportunity to be part of the teams that run the infrastructure that connects millions of sellers and customers

This is a full-time position based in Etsy’s Brooklyn office or remote in a US timezone.

About the Teams

The Observability team is a fluid and dynamic group. We work across Engineering to provide teams with tools, platforms and insights into how their systems are performing. The team strives for situational awareness; we know that failure happens, and sometimes we even cause them to happen on purpose. Being nice is a requirement. You will likely learn more about collaboration at Etsy than you have anywhere else.

About the Role

  • Manage the career development of a team of highly collaborative systems engineers
  • Contribute to technical discussions within your team to help increase the efficiency, stability, deliverability, and maintainability of everything your team produces
  • Participate in the greater company discussions to help set the direction for Etsy’s engineering team
  • Offer strategic direction, provide space for the team to create solutions
  • Work asynchronously with people spread geographically between Europe, East Coast and the West Coast
  • Regular 1:1s with team members, team meetings, representing the team within Systems Engineering and across the wider Engineering org
  • Curiosity regarding what makes people tick

About You

  • Have prior experience managing teams
  • Understand the importance of authenticity and mindfulness in leadership
  • Have excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Are as excited by the challenges of nurturing a team as you are by the technical challenges of building systems
  • Help those around you grow as engineers and be successful
  • Enjoy learning about and interacting with the people who use your systems
  • What is nice to have, but not essential
  • Relevant domain experience
  • Experience with bare metal and cloud environments

Why Etsy

  • We are very open about how we build things and the tools we have created to get things done. Read more on our technical blog, CodeAsCraft
  • We open source a lot of code
  • We have amazing offices in the heart of Dublin city and Brooklyn, and ensure our remote employees don’t miss out either!
  • We genuinely care about our talented teams and offer a fantastic parental leave policy, Health Care, Dental Care, Sabbatical leave and many more exciting benefits
  • Most importantly we’re a social bunch with global offices full of fun, innovation, awesome people and all kinds of interesting events and we are continuously growing!

What’s Next

Interested in joining the team? Send us a cover letter and your resume explaining why you’d be great for the job. We value individuality and variety, so make sure to tell us what you’re all about. If you have an online presence (blog, Twitter, Facebook), send it along. And if you write, draw, craft, or contribute to something you’re proud of, we’d love to hear about it.

Etsy is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants regardless of color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or family status, disability, gender identity or expression, veteran status, actual or presumed belonging to an ethnic group, or any other legally protected status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Country

Anywhere

items.title: VP Product
items.content:
VP Product at Footprint

San Francisco, Remote · Full Time
Skills
Javascript, Software Development, Product Management, Android, iOS Development, Programming: 3P APIs & Libraries, Product Development, Leadership, Enterprise Software, CTO, Cross-Functional Team Leadership, Cross Platform Mobile Development, Enterprise Architecture, Sales/Marketing and Strategic Partnerships, Leadership and Team Inspiration, Engineering Leadership, Engineering, Product Design, Start-Up CTO, React.js, Instrumentation, Go
Compensation
$100K–$175K
1.0%–4.0%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

As the VP Product at Footprint Labs, you'll be the leader of our product and engineering teams.

Working directly with our CEO (head of product), your mission is to achieve product parity across all platforms: Android, iPhone, iPad, mobile web, and desktop web--in parallel.

This means any action you can take on Footprint can be performed on every platform.

This means our production releases across all platforms are synced, too.

This means you're the captain, now.

About You: You're a missionary at heart and a proven technology leader both in your head and in practice.

You can execute software across multiple platforms, in parallel. You can build and manage a backlog, deploy resources accordingly, manage product managers and designers, and keep the backlog and other instrumentation devices updated weekly. Engineers, Product Managers, and Product Designers like working with you and for you. You play well with marketing and sales. You believe in an innovation-first approach but are well grounded in serving customer needs. When making decisions, you're skilled at making sense of gut vs. data. You've worked with distributed engineering teams. You understand and believe in Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery. You don't believe in process for process' sake, however, and can distinguish between tasks that need to be fully automated and those that need a lighter touch.

You want to help build a world-class company.

Responsibilities
- Manage product delivery across web (cross-browser), mobile web, iPhone, iPad, Android, and desktop apps
- Manage product design across web (cross-browser), mobile web, iPhone, iPad, Android, and desktop apps
- Manage design, product, and engineering communication
- Work closely with the CEO to define product
- Write software specs and manage the writing of specs
- Prepare product presentations to the CEO and board
- Recruit, train, and expand the entire product team at Footprint
- Instrument everything
- Talk to customers

items.title: Technical Sales Executive
items.content:
Technical Sales Executive at Promethean Energy

Mumbai, Remote · Full Time
Skills
Technical Sales
Compensation
₹400K–₹500K
No Equity

Job Description

Qualifications : Either B.Tech in Food technology/Dairy Technology/ Mechanical engineering/ Chemical engineering or diploma in similar fields. However, willing to look at other candidates with great communication skills and hunger to grow as a business development professional.
Preferably should have 2-4 years of technical sales experience selling to dairies/food & beverages or similar sector. Must have sold some equipment in the above spaces.

Job Roles :
a) Prospecting potential customers, identifying leads, setting up initial discussions.
b) Meeting potential clients at client site, concept-selling the product and first level discussions.
c) Meeting technical decision makers, including operators, plant managers at client site and discussing product features and value to the client.
d) Documenting the entire sales process with clients, including time of engagement, nature of response, time to follow-up, sizing the client potential, etc
e) Follow up with leads on regular basis, and continuous engagement with client to identify sales purchase process.
f) Execute against sales strategy defined by company and give constant feedback on effectiveness of strategy.
g) Regular updates with top management on progress.
Job will involve 15% of desk job (for prospecting, reporting, analysis etc), and 85% on the field interacting with clients.

Requirements in ideal candidate:
a) Must enjoy talking to new people and need to solve client problems.
b) Job is primarily on the field so candidate must be willing to travel.
c) Good communication skills – good command over English and Hindi (knowing the local language is a bonus)
